page.title: 19DARTMOUTH'S HINTERLAND (1)
page.content: Dartmouth is situated in a{rural {area}where farming has had a major impact upon the landscape. Although the emphasis is upon dairy farming and crops such as wheat and barley, there is a growing importance in{fruit farming.}Capton Fruit Farm is a good example, where a great variety of fruit is grown, mainly for sale in Dartmouth shops but also providing a {"pick your own"}service. Examples of fruit grown include strawberries, raspberries, gooseberries, rhubarb, logenberries and blackcurrents. There is also a stong trend towards the re-introduction of{grapes}to the area. There was a vineyard near the river before the{Second World War, which supplied{Covent Garden}by boat to Kingswear and then by G.W.R. to London. This vineyard declined during the war due to a lack of man power.
